props.text: Configure Puck with your own components to make change for your marketing pages without a developer.
This page demonstrates Puck configured with a custom component library. This component is called "Stats", and contains some made-up numbers. You can configure any page by adding "/edit" onto the URL.
Puck can also be extended with plugins and headless CMS content fields, transforming Puck into the perfect tool for your Content Ops.
Browse the Puck GitHub to get started, or try editing this page

props.title: Built for content teams
props.description: Puck enables content teams to make changes to their content without a developer or breaking the UI.

props.title: Easy to integrate
props.description: Front-end developers can easily integrate their own components using a familiar React API.

props.title: No vendor lock-in
props.description: Completely open-source, Puck is designed to be integrated into your existing React application.

props.title: plugin-heading-analyzer
props.description: Analyze the document structure and identify WCAG 2.1 issues with your heading hierarchy.

props.title: External data
props.description: Connect your components with an existing data source, like Strapi.js.

props.title: Custom plugins
props.description: Create your own plugin to extend Puck for your use case using React.
